reviews.text: I am planning another trip to Hotel Karbel and have just read some of the reviews. As a family we have been here 7 times and will not stay anywhere else. Yes the hotel is basic - if you want luxury go to the Sun City. Karbel is friendly, relaxed, clean and a pleasure to visit. The staff have been there for years and all seem happy in their jobs.
reviews.title: What a place!!!!

likes.disliked: — One waiter was a bit spooky but not a real hassle

reviews.text: #You don't need to go half board as the multuitude of restaurants in walking, or staggering, distance are so welcoming, cheap and value for money. These people are so welcoming my 60 year old mother went on her own and had a ball!!
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: One down side is the amount of money you can easily spend in the fantastic jewellers who will do anything you require - even propose!!!
reviews.title: fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Culture and history is easily found on the multitude of trips offered by your tour reps and travel agencies within the resort. "Bloody Gorgeous" will sell you anything - even his granny if you want her! He managed to get a 60 year old paragliding - I'm not sure who is the maniac - him or her!!!
reviews.title: Disappointed

likes.disliked: — did not deliver what was booked

reviews.text: The Blue Lagoon is great but Sunny Beach is quieter and quite spectacular. It's about a 20 minute walk from the hotel but worth the effort.
reviews.title: Cooking in Turkey - I will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have recently returned from a fantastic holiday at the Karbel. Overall, the hotel is excellent value for money, with good facilities and well kept grounds. It is kept spotlessly at all times.
reviews.title: Fantastic time!

reviews.text: The staff at the hotel are really helpful and very friendly. My partner really enjoyed playing water polo every day at 3 o'clock and there was entertainment every night apart from Mondays.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The air con in the room is excellent, and rooms although basic are very clean. The bathroom was a bit old fashioned, but everything worked ok!
reviews.title: Paradise In Turkey

likes.liked: — Friendly, clean, helpful, efficient, great food

reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday "HELLOW" Zekki
reviews.text: The balconies are a bit small, and only have space for two chairs (no table).

Breakfast was of a good standard, but a bit repetative and the drinks are limited - if you want fresh juice it is extra, and the juice that comes with breakfast is a very sugary cordial, no water available. We didn't eat in the hotel at night time, so I cannot comment on that. We sometimes had lunch round the pool and the baked potatoes were really nice, but the salad was a bit poor.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week in the Karbel hotel in OluDeniz and picked the resort from a number of positive reviews on this site.
reviews.title: A Holiday for people who don't like going abroad!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My title kind of sums up our feelings about both the resort and the hotel, we felt it was a holiday for people who don't like going abroad or experiencing new cultures.(I'm sorry but that's going to offend some people)
reviews.title: Nice and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both myself and my partner are quite well travelled and hence this review comes from experience.
reviews.title: A great surprise!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll start with the hotel:
reviews.title: Great little hotel
Good Hotel
reviews.text: -Room; the smallest I have EVER stayed in, it was like a prison cell in size, it had everything you need and was very clean and wasn't a huge problem as we didn't spend much time there.

reviews.title: Excellent sunny holiday resort
reviews.text: As per October review we are fairly well travelled, however, i don't think anyone goes to a resort like this expecting some sort of cultural exchange - there are a lot of English food places and the Waiters do like to generate some theatre outside their restaurants, however, the benefits of this really outweigh the negatives. The hotel - which is what this review is about (not the resort) is clean, well managed and the staff are friendly. The resort as a whole, and the hotel included is expensive compared to other resorts and areas we have visited. The hotel was a perfect place to kick back and make the most of the sun, the pool was big enough to avoid any splashing kids and there were plenty of places to sit and relax.

There are some great restaurants in Olu - Buzz Bar (simply the tastiest lunchtime kebabs you will ever eat - and for just £1.50!!) - Help bar (great cocktails) and the beach bar with the bean bags is a good place to watch the stars.
reviews.title: Turkish Waiters Leaches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are after a resort holiday - this is perfect. If you are a bit of a culture vulture - prob best looking elsewhere.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Agree with everyone else - avoid 'Bloody Gorgeous'
reviews.title: Wonderfull Holiday

reviews.text: The hotel itself was okay, but watch for the Waiters especially if you are a young single girl. I stayed with a friend, and after a few days one of the waiters Halil who had come down to the pool bar obviously to check out who he could stalk and get his way with next. He said he would show us around and would meet us in the other resort where we were going to see a show. He meet us afterwards then at the end of the night we pressumed we would be getting in a taxi back to the hotel, instead we were taken to the beach. He acted inappropiately and was I was glad to get back, this created an atmosphere when at Breakfast and Dinner he avoid coming near my table and was on to the next poor girl the following day. This spolit the holiday to a degree. At least I never had too much to drink! Just has well I was cautious of the Turkish men and had been warned. The rooms are okay quite small though the bathrooms are of a reasonable size. Maids do a great job. Pools are nice, we just felt a bit uncomfortable with the bar/waiter staff staring at you. Better to book trips in Turkey as the Reps charge mega prices. Went on a boat trip which cost just £5 with lunch. Drinks are expensive not cheap like they use to be abroad. Nice place, but not sure I would return to Turkey. Would feel safer if I was with a man. More suited to Couples.
reviews.title: Package Paradise!!!

likes.disliked: — The turks slight fascination with the girls in our group! (don't worry, they're not that bad!) but nothing else bad to say!
